snippet: Hundreds of people gathered in Manhattan to say goodbye to the comedian, who once wrote of the funeral she wanted: “a huge showbiz affair with lights, cameras, action.”
abstract: Fans, friends and family gather at Temple Emanu-El on Manhattan's Upper East Side to say goodbye and remember comedian Joan Rivers; many celebrities share humorous tributes and reminiscences in funeral that Hollywood all the way, just as she had wished.

byline.contributor: Emma G. Fitzsimmons, Sarah Maslin Nir and Nate Schweber contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Hundreds of people gathered in Manhattan to say goodbye to the comedian, who once wrote of the funeral she wanted: “a huge showbiz affair with lights, cameras, action.”

headline.main: At Joan Rivers’s Memorial, Celebrities, Cameras and Crowds
headline.print_headline: A Memorial of Mirth and Celebrity
